items.content:
Hello! And welcome to today's English class. Today's lesson will be different, as the entire lesson will be taught using this platform. If you need my help with anything, please raise your hand. As much as you can, do your best to work individually.

What? Work on this online lesson. It's better than a worksheet! Trust me.

How? Zelfstandig. Je mag muziek luisteren als je oortjes bij je hebt. Leidt anderen niet af.

How long? Deze les duurt ongeveer 30 minuten.

Result? Je hebt je voldoende kunnen voorbereiden op de toets.

Done? Verder leren voor Engels of stilletjes werken aan een ander vak.

Click on the right arrow to continue.

Good luck and have fun!

Let's go over today's lesson plan. Today'll will be a quick recap of all the grammar you'll have to learn for this unit's exam.

Lesson Goal

Exercise: Vocabulary

Grammar: Past Simple of irregular verbs

Grammar: Possessive

Grammar: Some / Any

Formative Test

Evaluation

At the end of today's class, you'll know how to:

  • talk about nature, house and home, technology, and holiday.
  • talk about certain events that happened in the past.
  • talk about people's or things' possessions
  • use some and any in a sentence

Unit 6 covered several themes to do with New Zealand from its wildlife to the interior of a Hobbit house to recycling electronics.

If you haven't studied the vocabulary yet, this next exercise can help you out.

prompt.body: Sleep de woorden naar het juiste plaatje.
Sleep de woorden naar het juiste plaatje.

items.content:
Click here if you would like to practice some more vocabulary.

Click here to continue with the grammar section.

You're here because you wanted to practice your vocabulary. That's great!

Let's have another look at some of the vocabulary you have to learn.

prompt.body: Sleep de woorden naar de juiste plaatjes.
Sleep de woorden naar de juiste plaatjes.

items.content:
Goob job with the vocabulary!

Unit 6 has quite a bit of grammar:

  • Irregular verbs
  • Past simple of to be
  • Possessive
  • Some / any

Next, we're going to have a quick recap of the grammar. It never hurts to refresh your memory.

I have added a quick summary (samenvatting) of all of the grammar taught this unit.

In order to continue, you'll have to answer at least 4 out of 5 questions correctly. This is to ensure you understand the grammar.

There are many irregular verbs. We have practiced these quite a bit.

The past simple of to be is extra irregular:

  • There isn't just one form, but two: was and were.
  • Questions and negative (ontkennende) sentences don't use did + verb, but was or were.
+ - ?
I was wasn't Was I?
You were weren't Were you?
He / She / It was wasn't Was he / she / it?
We / You / They were weren't Were we / you / they?

content.body: They (to have) five minutes to catch their bus.
The past simple of 'to have' is 'had'.
The past simple of 'to have' is 'had'.
We (to go) to the beach last weekend.
The past simple of to go is went.
My sister (to get) a new smartphone for her birthday.
The past simple of to get is got.

items.content:
Possession of people or animals

Singular 's This is my friend's book.
Plural ending on -s ' These are my sisters' books.
Plural not ending on -s 's These are the children's books.
Names ending on -s -x -z ' / 's This is Jess' / Jess's book.

Possession of things

Singular ... of ... He was on the cover of a magazine.
Plural ... of ... The noise of the machines is very loud.
Location ... of ... We are in the city of London.

content.body: Bezit van mensen of dieren in het enkelvoud: 's
Bezit van dingen in het enkelvoud: ... of ...
Bezit van mensen waarvan de naam eindigd op -s: ' of 's.
Bezit van dingen in het enkelvoud: ... of ...
Bezit van mensen of dieren in het meervoud: '

items.content:
When do we use some?

  • For positive (bevestigende) sentences.
  • If the question is an offer (aanbod), suggestion (voorstel), or request (verzoek).

When do we use any?

  • For negative (ontkennende) sentences.
  • All other questions.

prompt.body: Have you got ___ plans for the weekend?

content.body: Je gebruikt any in vragen die geen aanbod, voorstel of verzoek zijn.
Je gebruikt any in vragen die geen aanbod, voorstel of verzoek zijn.

prompt.body: ___ of these questions are pretty easy.
Didn't you answer ___ any of the questions correctly?

content.body: Je gebruikt any in vragen die geen aanbod, voorstel of verzoek zijn.
Je gebruikt any in vragen die geen aanbod, voorstel of verzoek zijn.

items.content:
Good job on practicing the grammar!

Je gaat nu de oefentoets maken. Aan de hand van je antwoorden kan ik zien of je nog hulp nodig hebt met de verschillende onderdelen.
Thank you so much for taking part in today's lesson! Please be honest when you fill in the form below. It'll help me improve my future lessons.

I hope you found this lesson useful.

Thank you for participating in today's lesson.

You may continue to study for your English exam or work on another subject.

Please don't bother the other studetns, as they may still be hard at work.
